metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5137 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The CSPSource::schemeMatches function in WebKit/Source/core/frame/csp/CSPSource.cpp in the Content Security Policy (CSP) implementation in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.82, does not apply http :80 policies to https :443 URLs and does not apply ws :80 policies to wss :443 URLs, which makes it easier for remote attackers to determine whether a specific HSTS web site has been visited by reading a CSP report.  NOTE: this vulnerability is associated with a specification change after CVE-2016-1617 resolution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5137` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-browser-l10n - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-chromedriver - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.16.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
